topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53bf46106368723ddb380400#post_53bf46106368723ddb380400
Only play it on console; the computer controls are complete shit.

Rarely do I ever say this about a game, but I have it for steam and the control on pc are horrible.  The reason why the pc controls are terrible is that they have the controls as the equivalent of the controller and you're not allowed to change it; meaning that x is literally x and so forth so you have to have the most horribly mangled hands in the world to play it on steam.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53bf4c676368723ddb950600#post_53bf4c676368723ddb950600
[bq="uc9"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53bf46106368723ddb380400#post_53bf46106368723ddb380400
Only play it on console; the computer controls are complete shit.

Rarely do I ever say this about a game, but I have it for steam and the control on pc are horrible.  The reason why the pc controls are terrible is that they have the controls as the equivalent of the controller and you're not allowed to change it; meaning that x is literally x and so forth so you have to have the most horribly mangled hands in the world to play it on steam.[/bq]

You can actually change the controls on Jet Set Radio. I have them set up to what I've always felt the standard emulator controls are, or have been for me. WASD is movement and the num pad fills the rolls of X and Y and all those other buttons.

When the game boots up you can change the controls to how you feel is fit. It's not just a screen showing how to do what.

I can't remember if there's a button to save the settings or not, I assume there is though since I only had to do it once and I get to happily skip that screen whenever it comes up. You can also change the graphic settings there too.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53bf57ae6368727f35220300#post_53bf57ae6368727f35220300
[bq="Whatevs"]

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53bf574d6368727ea6a00200#post_53bf574d6368727ea6a00200
not sure if I believe that[/bq]
On paper the procedure for handling rape cases is supposed to be the exact opposite and promote rape victims to come forward to the police. . . in reality though when my sister was raped by my step-dad he walked away scott clean even though he raped a minor cause of some bullshit.  Basically because she didn't go the hospital immediately they said that it wouldn't stand up in court.  What's worse is I've seen shit like this in Texas and it seems to be the norm.  Another instance was years ago a friend of mine turns out her husband was raping their daughter for years and it took fricking ages to get him put behind bars; I think the way they arrested him was cops were at their house waiting for him to try something if I'm not mistaken.  Another instance I've seen was a church I went to a person got arrested for hitting his wife and raping her in front of their kids and guess what?  He walked away free.

On paper Texas is supposed to actively fight this shit, but the cops basically have their hands tied behind their backs in all sorts of bullshit and told to "do their job" while being dissuaded from looking into events.  Unless the cops here witness a rape first hand then there's a damn good chance that the person will get away with it cause the way Texas handles rape cases is that to use a analogy they would have to catch you while you're robbing a bank in order for them to have enough evidence to arrest you.

I'm not blaming the cops, rather there's some severe red string bullshit that ties their hands behind their backs that pretty much makes them useless in these cases.
